used to say that someone cannot have, take, or touch something
Hey! Hands off that CD! Itâ€™s mine!

a hands-off way of organizing something involves letting people do what they want and make their own decisions, without telling them what to do
The government has a hands-off approach to the industry.
not telling the people you are in charge of exactly what to do, but letting them make their own decisions
His hands-off approach to management was seen by some as laziness.
